metadata.description: Specifies the type of storage account, if being created.
Specifies whether the storage account should be created or already exists.
Specifies a storage container in the account specified by 'vhdStorageAccount' in which user images of XenApp 7.7 reside.
Specifies whether the template should deploy from the Azure Marketplace gallery or from user images in the storage account specified by 'vhdStorageAccount.
Specifies an additional qualifier to use for Marketplace image references. The value 'preview' is for images in staging, while the default value references production images.

Specifies a unique public DNS prefix for the deployment. This will produce a FQDN of the form '<publicDnsName>.<location>.cloudapp.azure.com'. Up to 62 chars, digits or dashes, lowercase, should start with a letter: must conform to '^[a-z][a-z0-9-]{1,61}[a-z0-9]$'.
Specifies the resource group which should contain the public IP.
Specifies the resource name for the public IP. New IPs will take this name, while references to existing ones should be valid.
Specifies whether the public IP should be created or already exists.
Specifies the size of the virtual machines (6).
Specifies the name of the administrator for machines, Active Directory domain, NetScaler and XenApp. Exclusion list: 'admin','administrator'. Must be no more than 9 alphanumeric characters.
Specifies the password of the administrator for machines, Active Directory domain, NetScaler and XenApp.
Specifies the name of the newly created Active Directory domain.

Specifies the email address that that will be used to request a public SSL certificate for NetScaler gateway from letsencrypt.org on your behalf. This will also be used to notify you when the template has deployed successfully.
Specifies whether an ACME CA or the internal Enterprise CA should be used for obtaining certificates.
Specifies the ACME protocol server used for public TLS certificate requests. Allowed values correspond to letsencrypt.org staging or production.

Specifies additional inbound NAT rules to apply in this deployment. Useful for exposing individual machines more directly. The parameter is specified as an object, as in the default. See variable 'loadBalancerSettings' for an example format.

Specifies additional applications to be installed on the VDA and published through XenApp. The parameter is specified as an array of objects, as in the default. See variables 'applications', 'vdaSettings', and 'storeFrontSettings' for an example format.
Specifies the base location of the child templates and desired state configuration scripts.
Specifies the shared access signature token which provides access to the base artifacts location.
Specifies the shared access signature token which provides access to the base artifacts location.
Specifies If Need to Connect to Cloud Connector or Bringup DDC.
This is the customer ID available in the Citrix Cloud console on the API Access page (within Identity and Access Management).
Found on the API Access page. This is the secure client ID an administrator can create.
Found on the API Access page. This is the secure client secret available via download after a secure client is created.
This ID can be retrieved on the Resource Locations page using the ID button.
Specify if the DDC used to provision is in test Control Plane or Production Control Plane
Specify wether VDI should be provisioned or Not.
If there is custom Script that needs to run on Connector.
If there any Arguments that needs to be passed to script.
Select if Default Client VDI should be installed or any custom version of VDI needs to be installed.
If customClientVDI is selected, Enter the path of VDI Installer or else leave it blank.
Select if Default Server VDI should be installed or any custom version of VDI needs to be installed.
If customServerVDI is selected, Enter the path of VDI Installer or else leave it blank.
